data.text: @forevnalways I got Taylor's very first album for my 13th birthday- she was 16. She's always been a few steps ahead of me when it came to love, and her albums have seen me through MS, HS, college, and adult life. It's a bond you can't replicate.
@forevnalways wOW AM I FUCKING EMO THIS IS EXACTLY HOW IT FELT GROWING IL BEING A SWIFTIE
@longlive13x “I feel you forget me like i used to feel you breathe” THAT LINE FEELS LIKE BEING PUNCHED IN THE STOMACH
@forevnalways But then as I grew up, I learned what the words meant and it all fell into its place
@forevnalways I had no clue what Taylor said until mid 2011 because I didn’t know English, I just loved her rhythm and the sound of her voice

@forevnalways @fiorellaswift89 Agree. I was 13 when I became a fan of hers, and she had only released Fearless by then. At the time her debut was my anthem for that longing kind of love/crush. I was always a couple years behind on how I related to the songs because of the age gap.
@forevnalways At 19 I can actually relate to songs because I feel her pain as you say

@forevnalways This is the most accurate description I’ve ever read!! I was 12 when I became a fan of hers and my english was very bad so I didn’t even understand halve the lyrics she sang lol yet I would memorize all the words then I looked them up so I ‘knew’ what the meaning but now

and this is why i want to meet her so bad. i want to thank her for putting into words emotions i’ve felt in the last 11 years of being a fan, and letting me know i’m not alone and something beautiful can come out of every heartbreak

it and you KNOW what taylor was feeling when she wrote it. that’s how last kiss was for me. i knew every word when i was 10, but now at 19 i cant sing or listen to the words without breaking down into tears. that’s how powerful taylor and her words are.
